message: And what bus line do you ride so I can mug you?
i di...wait. no
i didn't
yeah that.
i want
I will wait for next version.
High-red retina display on iPad 3
MB Air has killed iPad2 :)
Lol, yea. It's a bit more expensive but there is a physical keyboard and more stuff.
Trying to buy one .. Who has them in stock
It's totally worth it for the smart cover alone. A genius piece of accessory engineering. Makes the entire device more functional and usable
@tbeseda but can it hold the ipad up in a vertical position?
Nope. that's its only weak point. I use a Compass stand from 12south for vertical orientation at my desk.
Ibl
I love it. It's so nice

So, who had an iPad1 and now has an iPad2? Can you convince me after using the iPad2 that I need to upgrade now and not wait for iPad3. Please don't tell me that it's very cool and you just like it better. Is the experience worth the upgrade?

@DaddyFlo I had the first one, and sold it the day of the announcement and have since upgraded. First and foremost, it's fast. Like, really fast. Second, the smart cover is fantastic, Third, the cameras are worthless, unless you actually use video conferencing/Facetime. Last the size difference does enhance the experience, it's nicer to hold, but it's not a game-changer.
So, to me, it was worth the $100 I lost in the upgrade (sold my iPad 1 for $400). Could I live without it? Absolutely; but I'm glad I don't have to.
Mines on order says 18th-25th delivery (fingers crossed) held off on 1st Gen can't wait!
Sold my iPad 1 and got my iPad 2 on Day 1 on Kijiji - BNIB

For me, the 32 GB was never enough with my first iPad and the 64 GB is perfect with my iPad 2 but it's only been 10 days. I think it really depends on what type of user you are and how you intend to use it.
Do you feel like a 16gb isn't enough room? And 3G or wifi?

I plan to get one asap. I usually buy the smallest storage. First it's $100+ cheaper which adds up quickly when you buy this stuff every year. Also the 64 gig doesn't store everything I would need so if I have to manage the storage anyway I might as well save the money. I use 4 gigs for apps. Usually 3 gigs for music and podcasts, and leaves enough space to take pictures, videos, or add a few movies to watch.
@Lyle, smart move.  I got the 16GB phone thinking that it was enough as I already  had an iPad but I constantly run out of space.  My next iPhone will have to be 32 GB.
I got the 32 iPhone and was happy I did but I might have went a little crazy at first, think I'd at least want the same for iPad
I was unsure about storage size, but the new iTunes Home Sharing has eliminated much of my need to store
Movies on it. 16gb for me!
What do you guys put on your iPads / iPhones that consume so much space? With rdio and Air Video I have next to nothing on mine (except for about 5GB in apps).
@barkerja music library, photo library. I do alot of digital art. It all accumulates and everyone is different.
i've watched the wire almost exclusively on my ipad
videos for plane rides where i don't trust the onboard wifi to stream air video/netflix fast enough

It's about being fully mobile and I travel a far amount. I am a big believer in having options so there's always something of interest to me and whoever I happen to be with at the time. Usually I have to share with little and big people.
@barkerja honestly mostly podcasts and books, bit of music
i use it to browsing the web and emails, google reader, reading ebooks, youtube, and an occasional movie when traveling - and 16gb wifi is good enough for me
The lack of any noticeable update on the iPad's display was a deal breaker for me. Sticking with the original until iPad 3's release.

It makes the original feel like a slab of granite. Noticeably faster and the graphics are beautiful. So much slimmer and lighter. Even though, technically it is only a few ounces lighter they nailed the weight distribution. I can read on this thing for hours. I think it's a nice evolutionary leap.

I have 32gb since December (iPad 1) and my current usage is close to 20GB already. I use it mostly as "news stand", "comics books kiosk", portable gaming platform and portable movie player. I think that 32gb is optimal as for now and 64gb safe not to cross the magic moment of 50% space used.
@tbeseda i hear it makes the screen dirty, just like their case for ipad 1
@Lyle I would go with WiFi if U have an iPhone with latest update, acting as WiFi hotspot for up to 5 devices, no? Saves another 3G subscription plan :-)
@ShermanHu 3 devices with the official hotspot.
@rcs 3? Ok, 3 it is :-)
